abstract: The defense seemed increasingly self-assured in a stance others have offered before: Regardless of whether the accusations against President Trump are true, his actions still would not justify his removal from office.
lead_paragraph: As a growing chorus of Republican senators declared on Wednesday that they felt ready to move to a final vote without calling new witnesses, the president’s legal team delivered several bold answers to senators’ questions. Among the most remarkable was an argument from Alan M. Dershowitz, who suggested that anything President Trump might have done in the service of his own re-election effort was in the public interest.
